af: West Germanic language, spoken in South Africa and Namibia
ar: Semitic language and lingua franca of the Arab world
bn: Indo-Aryan language mostly spoken in Bangladesh and India
cy: Brythonic language spoken natively in Wales
da: North Germanic language spoken in Denmark
de: West Germanic language spoken mainly in Central Europe
es: Romanic language originating in the Iberian Peninsula
fa: Southwestern Iranian dialect continuum spoken in the Caucasus, Central Asia, Iran, Kuwait, and Pakistan
fi: Finno-Ugric language mostly spoken in Finland
gu: Indo-Aryan language that is spoken on the state of Gujarat
hr: standardized variety of Serbo-Croatian language, used by Croats
ko: language spoken in Korean Peninsula and some part of North-eastern China
lv: Baltic language, official in Latvia and the European Union
mk: South Slavic language mostly spoken in North Macedonia and its neighbouring countries
no: North Germanic language spoken in Norway
pa: Indo-Aryan language spoken in the Punjab region of Pakistan and India
pt: Western Romance language of the Indo-European language family
ro: Eastern Romance language, official of Romania
sk: West Slavic language spoken in Slovakia
sl: South Slavic language spoken primarily in Slovenia
so: Afroasiatic language belonging to the Cushitic branch
sq: Indo-European language, spoken in Albania, Kosovo, North Macedonia and Montenegro as well as Italy, Croatia, Romania and Sebia
sv: North Germanic language spoken in Sweden and Finland
sw: Bantu language spoken mainly in East Africa
ta: Dravidian language native to South India and Sri Lanka
te: Dravidian language native to South India
tl: Austronesian language and the national language of the Philippines
tr: Oghuz Turkic language of the Turkish people
ur: Indo-Aryan language spoken in South Asia
zh-cn: standard form of Chinese and the official language of China
zh-tw: variety of Mandarin serving as the official language of the Republic of China (Taiwan)
